result.execSummary:
The defendant George Derrick Budd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

3:22  Defendant George Derrick Budd in court with attorney Kenneth Charles Pletcher.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie 16CM123 Plead to Ct 2  16CM124Plead to Ct 1    S/W Probation 1 year.  Court does not know if they can go along with this sentence. Atty Pletcher wants to speak with defendant.  Recess 3:23  3:27  Court resumes the defendant does wish to go ahead with this agreement. The remaining counts will be dismissed but used as read-ins  Defendant pleads guilty to Ct 2 in 16CM123 and in 16CM124 Ct 1.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 2 16CM123 and Ct 1 of 16CM124. The remaining counts in each case are dismissed but used as read in for sentence.Arguements are given and defendant makes a statement.  Court orders - S/W Probation 2 yrs on 16CM123 Ct 2 and 16CM124 Ct 1 concurrent. Conditions:  No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. Court costs DNA sample and surcharge. 30 days jail stayed on condition that the defendant does not drink. Comply with any treatment or counseling as required by probation.  Restitution as determined within 60 days.  A written apology to be made to the victim.   2 days credit if revoked.
Status conference on November 22, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: 9:20  16CM124 Defendant George Derrick Budd in court with attorney Kenneth Charles Pletcher.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Judge Boles will recuse himself - food friend of the defendant.
Status conference on October 3, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 26, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
to Appear signed by George Derrick Budd

04:10 16CM123 also heard at this time. Defendant George Derrick Budd in court, in custody VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ.  Attorney Ken Pletcher appears in the court room for the defendant.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has copy of complaints.   Court reads charges and possible penalties of both complaints.   Defendant waives reading of the complaints.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Defendant pleads not guilty to all charges in both 16CM123 and 16CM124. 16CM123 Thorie recommends: $150 cash bond remain on file with add'l provision.  No objection.  Court orders $150 cash bond on 16CM123.  16CM124 Thorie requests $300 cash bond.  No objection.  Court orders $300 cash bond on 16CM124.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Bail Bond Envelope, Notice Regarding Bond Posting and Booking Sheet
Pre-trial conference on July 5, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
